final_prompt: Underwater ROV documentary footage of a weathered statue/figurine of a human figure partially buried in a sandy seafloor, covered in sediment and marine growth with outstretched arms visible. The water is turquoise-green with poor visibility, clear natural lighting from above, and minimal particulate matter. Camera performs an exploratory sequence combining lateral tracking movements, pulls back while tilting up, and pans left to frame the statue from different angles.
negative_prompt: No people visible in frame, no fish or marine life, no artificial lighting, no neon or saturated colors, no stabilization, no smooth camera movements, no CGI effects, no text overlays
confidence_notes: Main subject identified as statue with high confidence (95%) from ROI captions despite lower hypothesis confidence (0.5)
Camera motion labels are derived from reliable motion analysis algorithms
Water color and visibility are explicitly documented
No fish or people detected in negatives section confirms safe to exclude
used_evidence: Keyframe ROI captions for statue appearance: weathered, partially buried, sediment, algae, outstretched arms, facial features
Environment descriptors: turquoise-green water, poor visibility, sandy bottom, minimal particulate
Camera motion labels from motion analysis with smoothness scores
Negatives: no people, fish, text, or artificial light detected
